Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel keep of”
Reviews.Author: guatamssgi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is no doubt in a good and peaceful area but I would not recommend this hotel for a Buinsess Traveller , the Hotel staff is disorganised and the Bell desk is horrible , you have to look of staff and 100% until you keep complaning nothing will be sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception and location”
Reviews.Author: Chris E
Reviews.Content: We had a prepaid booking, we arrived tired and early at 8:00 am after an overnight flight. The girl on reception was very friendly and allowed us to check-in early and take our room straight away at no extra cost. The room was quiet. We were able to sleep for a couple of hours before starting to sightsee. The hotel is very close to both Metro/underground lines and a Big Bus Tour stop,

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - Embassy District - Dubai”
Reviews.Author: as260478
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. Rooms are spotless and comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful. It was ideal base for a few days before a cruise - 15 mins from the airport and 15 mins from the cruise terminal. It's 3 minute walk away from the Metro which is very cheap and easy to get around Dubai. Approx £3 gets you an all day ticket - hop on and off as much as you wish, includes bus connections at stops too ! The Hotel is also a 3/4 mins walk away from Burjamin Mall. Loads of shops, ATMs and cafes/restaurants. Breakfast was included in the hotel price, which gave a large selection of hot & cold items including a omellete/egg station. The hotel also provides free bus shuttle to the beach. Not quite 4 star - but a very good 3 !

Reviews.Title: “Good, but in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: Up until recently this was the Excelsior Creek Hotel. I guess that becoming a Holiday Inn means a general upgrade of the building, but for the moment being the lobby and the rooms remain as years ago, looking quite old-fashioned and crying out for some refurbishment. But apart from that, it's not a bad hotel at all. A few minutes away from one of only 2 metro stations where both lines meet, it provides easy access to most anywhere in Dubai. As a Priority Club Platinum member I was upgraded to a bigger room that included a huge fruit platter and 1-hour internet. The rooftop swimming-pool is OK, although it was so windy that I skipped it, and I would have used the sauna, but they have different times for women and men and I chose the wrong one. All in all, not a bad option in Dubai, but I might try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better choices”
Reviews.Author: SeanNorwich
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while exhibiting at Arab Health - left it late to book so my colleagues, who booked earlier, got a much better hotel at a lower rate. Location is quite central but the area has a rather run down appearance and has nothing going for it apart from being convenient for the Metro as the station is a 2/3 minute walk away. Rooms are spacious and of a good standard. Breakfast is ok, does not particularly cater for western tastes but you can get a decent omlette or fried eggs, avoid the beef bacon. I stayed in a second floor room and was never disturbed by any loud music and was not aware of any working girls frequenting the hotel. they are around in a lot of Dubai hotels but were not visible in this one. There is a small rooftop pool that could do with a facelift and the views, only 4 stories up, are nothing special. Overall a reasonable hotel but not worth what I had to pay

Reviews.Title: “Better Service Than Intercontinental Dubai !!!”
Reviews.Author: Mostynboy
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 5 days this week. The hotel is comfortable and well positioned for business purposes. Facilities are great and the staff are just outstanding - most notably the duty manager Juned and the concierge Neil but not excluding any of the staff at the hotel. Everyone bends over backwards to make your stay a great experience through premium level hospitality and consideration. Only one recommendation. A VERY minor negative is that getting a taxi is not the easiest (I had to hang around for over 30 minutes this morning) so please look at what can be done to improve this. I do recommend the excellent Indian restaurant at the hotel. Food is absolutely delicious and is great value. I wish there was an equivalent close to my home - I would be there all the time !! I do not want to wax lyrical about how great the place is. I just want to say many congratulations to everyone at the hotel and thanks for making this visit to Dubai a pleasure. I will most certainly be back. Believe me, the Intercontinental Festival City in Dubai can learn a lot about customer service from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TonyW1961
Reviews.Content: This is a good business hotel close to the centre of Dubai, the creek and Sheik Zayed Rd. The hotel facilities are good - the English pub, restaurants and rooftop pool are all very pleasant - they are not as luxurious as other Dubai hotels but at less than £100 per night that is to be expected. The rooms were large and everything was clean and comfortable. I would have no hesitation staying there again if I had business in that part of town. Note: this hotel has only recently been taken over by Holiday Inn so most Taxi drivers did not know where it was - either use the name of the previous hotel (Excelsior I think) or get a card from recption with the address on.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MustaphaEido
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel , excellent location near metro station and burjuman center across the street . good welcoming staff all were helpful and courteous . rooms are clean and large bed and large bathroom but i didn't like the cheap bathroom amenities also the towels were so old and need to be removed . nice restaurant for breakfast but old and dirty disgusting utensils . i liked this hotel and hope to stay there again after they remove the towels and the old utensils

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to Stay in Bur Dubai....”
Reviews.Author: Kunal5988
Reviews.Content: All in all, a very good hotel. Very good location. Next to Burjuman Mall and Khaleed Bin Walid Metro Station. Rooms very very good, neat and clean. Breakfast buffet had wide range of food items specially Indian food. My 4 nights stay went extremely smoothly except my earlier correspondence for room preference wasn't taken care of. I had talked to their manager Mr Fady [--] on email where he said my rooms have been booked according to my preference but that wasn't the case. I was given the rooms which were available then. Please take the rooms on 3rd floor, as there are 2 night clubs on the ground floor which are open till 4 am and their vibrations can be felt on 1 and 2 floor but 3rd floor is fine.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: travelocity99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely first rate. A very beautiful, warm lobby greeted us. The staff was very helpful. On request, they gave us a room which was located far away from their night clubs - so it was very quiet. The rooms were good, the bathrooms were good too. The breakfast was delicious with a lot of variety. We had meals sometimes in the hotel - and we were never disappointed. There was a special kids menu which had spaghetti, hot dogs, pizza etc. Location is the best point - there is Burjuman mall and Metro station at walking distance. Lots of eateries around and lots of cheap supermarkets too. I shall definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller to Duabi, I was a little baffled as to which location I needed to get the most out of my time there, but I feel very lucky to have come across the Excelsior. Though very few taxi drivers knew where it was located, a simple show of the map and I was there in less than 10 minutes from every mall I had visited. Bank and stores are literally across the street. Tours are offered in the lobby. Restaurants, buffet and night club all on premesis. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Very Clean! One problem was a mix up with paying for one of my meals at the buffet...took 30minutes to sort at check-out. Other than that, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy and awful - DON'T Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: paymaan
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the early hours of Saturday, 26 November. The reception here was very messy and disorganized - I wish I had taken photo of it. There is a nightclub in the hotel and there is no mention of this on the hotel website. The lobby was full of prostitutes and it felt very sleezy. The disco music noise went through until 4am! The towels were stained and it was an overall awful experience - the hotel is a disgrace to the Intercontinental Hotel Group - only chose to stay there because of being Platinum Priority Member - Do yourself a big favour and book to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maureen600
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was until recently called Excelsior Creek Hotel and there are many reviews on Tripadvisor under that name. We stayed for 4 nights in November 2011 just after its change to a Holiday Inn. Apart from one little thing we could not fault it, especially for the price paid. As stated it is situated in the Bur Dubai district which is the older part of Dubai, and is a 5 minute walk to Khalid Bin Al Waleed Metro station which gives access to both the red and green lines of the metro. Only one other Metro station has that advantage. The metro is fantastically efficient and cheap and it takes 15 minutes maximum to travel to the Hotel from the airport. There are 4 exits from the Metro and you need to take exit 4 for the shortest route to the hotel. When you come out of the Metro station you will be directly opposite a shop called "And So To Bed". Facing that shop there is an area of sandy waste ground to the right of the shop. If you cross that to the street on the other side of it and look right you will see the Hotel with its green facade 100 yards or so along the road. One thing, though, it is difficult to wheel cases across the sand so you could walk past the bed shop and then a right turn and take a slightly longer route on foot. The land oppposite the hotel is vacant and presumably eventually will be a building site, but nothing is currently happening there. As to the Hotel, we had a standard deluxe room which was plently large enough for two. Due to previous reviewers mentioning noise from the bars on the ground floor we requested a 3rd (top) floor room at the front. We had room 358 and heard no noise whatsoever. The twin beds were large and very comfortable with nice clean, crisp linen. The airconditioning worked well. All usual facilities were there (iron, safe, kettle, mini bar fridge, etc.). The bathroom was good with shower over the bath. Usual toiletries provided. There was also a complimentary UAE newspaper every day. The room was very clean. Our only complaint was the smell of drains in the bathroom, not sewage exactly, more like damp, dirty, musty floor cloths left in a bucket for a long time instead of being hung out to dry. We didn't ask to be moved because we had unpacked etc and couldn't be bothered for 4 nights, but did mention it at the end of our stay. However, leaving the plugs in the bath and basin and the airconditioning on helped. We found all members of staff to be very polite, friendly and courteous. We used the free shuttle to the beach park once (small admission charge to beach park) and that was efficient. Probably about a 30 minute drive each way. There was one trip out at 10am and one trip back at 3pm. We didn't eat in the hotel at all or use the sauna or gym. However, we did use the rooftop pool. This is fairly small but there was only ever a few people using it at any one time. Plenty of nice towels which were free to use. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MissyQw8
Reviews.Content: As regular travellers to Dubai, my husband and I usually stay in the Bur Dubai area as it is so accessible (a) from the airport & (b) to all shopping areas. This trip, after some research, we chose to stay at the Excelsior Creek hotel, mainly due to a great deal found on Octopustravel. The hotel is relatively new, the rooms are clean and spacious and thank goodness have a separate bathroom, unlike many of the other newer hotels in which we have stayed. The breakfast, which was inclusive with our deal, was adequate, the selection not as varied as some, but good value. The staff were very efficient and friendly, no problems with either check in or our request for a late checkout. The location of the hotel is a five minute walk to/from Khalid al Walid metro station, Bur Jurman shopping centre. It is an easy 15 min walk to to bastakiya area where you can catch an abra across the creek to the spice & gold souks, or set off in the opposite direction and stroll through the bur Dubai textile & fabric souks. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ppiieeff
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not too far from the airport and 5 minutes from the Burjuman shopping centre and red bus stop. Breakfast good choice. Staff helpfull. First time in Dubai on our way to Europe, if I did it again I would have no hesitation to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: SANJEEVOHRI
Reviews.Content: if u are looking for good hotel in bur dubai. This property is recommended. Lots of indians can be found here. You will simply love the total experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: beaviscs
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Service was very good . Breakfast buffet fresh and omeletes, waffels and pancakes made for you. Location worked well for us with the metro only a block away and next to Burjuman Centre. Taxi from airport was less than 50 aed. Room and bathroom was spacious. We were on the 1st floor at the front of the hotel and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: carrolynp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent for medium budget family trip as well as business. The roof top pool was open till 11PM and wonderful for an after dinner swim. Staff very friendly and helpful. They had a travel operator desk which arranged excellent tours and gave some good advice. The breakfast was a bit boring but satisfying. Location is great. Many shops close by as well as the Metro station and a Mall. Very easy to get a taxi cab as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: yanivv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in right place of the Dubai City. Metro is walkable, just 150 meters in the corner. Food is nice, but typical Indian Food. I should specifically say "North Indian Orientation" in the food. However lot of continental food is also available. The rooms are very nice n clean. Room Service can be better, we have to request them to make up the room. The hotel does offers lot of organised trips & they are very cost effective. The hotel staff is helpful. There were no noisy clubs, i was staying at weekend, & no non-sense place to stay. It is nice to place to stay, no exorbitant prices & no flashy place. Very Good Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: antheazeeman
Reviews.Content: Close to the metro with friendly staff. Aircon was temperamental and the Internet was a bit costly. Buffet was not that good and the pool was not worth going to, the water was way too hot!

Reviews.Title: “Liked a lot”
Reviews.Author: iideetee
Reviews.Content: New hotel with helpful staff. It was hard to find with taxi cause it was brand new hotel(Took about 1 hour to find it). One of the shopping malls is next to hotel and with cheap taxi or metro is easy to go where ever you want. There was couple noisy clubs on the ground floor, otherwise I liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for 1st time visit”
Reviews.Author: Angel2010Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights on a room only basis. You can get a metro from the airport and you dont have to walk far to the hotel. Hotel also right next to Burjaman shopping centre and there are alot of cheap eating places in the neighbourhood, ie kebabs & fresh juice. You can walk to the creek & to the dubai museum. Hotel can be out the way for other attractions but the metro is on the doorstep and is very cheap & efficient. Check in is stated as 2pm, we arrived 10am and was giving a room straight away. Room is clean, you get a pair of slippers and the gulf news every day, apart from the day you leave. The only really downside was the noise coming from the disco, beating away till early hours of the money. Pool is small with no great view as the hotel is in between residential blocks. Sometimes, housekeeping will forget to restock items ie toilet paper, coffee... We tried the evening meal buffet one night for 70dirhams, it has a wide selection but was nothing special. You should try the all you can eat far eastern seafood restaurant in the Regent hotel opposite the Burjaman shopping centre. It has a wide range of seafood cooked in a choice of styles and sauces Thai style. The starters are lovely - king prawns, mussles, local crab, (lobster is extra), squid ... You simply shoose what you want and they cook it for you. There were some colourful fish you could have as your mains - burracudas etc and we even had baby shark Overall, the hotel is well located for that first time visit in Dubai. The hotel will ask for a 500 dirham deposit on arrival or you can give them a credit card where they hold this amount on your card.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: JessFromSweden
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is a little off, far from the city centre without anything particular to see around the hotel, but who cares? It's not like you can walk around in Dubai anyway, everyone's going by taxi, and it's fairly cheap, about 25 dirhams to most malls and to burj khalifa, 35 dirhams to Jumeirah beack park and burj el arab. Burjaman mall is just around the corner from the hotel, and there's a small supermarket called E-mart across the street, where you can find all the necessities. The lobby and the hotel restaurant Anwar is a real treat. We had breakfast and dinner included and it was well worth the money. The breafast had several hot dishes, fruit and vegetables, yoghurt, breads, croissants, juice, tea/coffee, cakes, eggs and omelets made on request, pancakes etc. The dinner buffet was very impressive. Atleast 20 varieties of salads, about the same amount of sauces like hoummus, dijon vinaigrete etc, excellent hot dishes (different dishes every night, a mix of indian, thai, libanese, italian and arabic cuisine) and the most amazing dessert buffet with everything you can ask for. Beer and wine is not included but available if you pay for it. It's not cheap, but the quality is good. The staff is always at your service and they're extremly polite. As soon as we stepped out of the taxi the staff welcomed us and offered to carry our bags. We were given fresh mango juice when we arrived and the check-in went very smoothly. Even the elevators are opened for you on a regular basis. The rooms are big, very clean and the bed is comfortable. The shower is fine. Towels and sheets are crispy white and clean. Iwas happy with the "house keeping" as they call it, and the laundry service. They clean the room every day, quite early around 9.30 am. A laundry guy will knock on your door at 9 am, if you hand them the laundry before 10 am you will get it back the same day around 8 pm. If you hand them the laundry later you will get it back the following day. We were staying at the top floow (3rd floor) as requested and there was no noise whatsoever, we slept like babies all thru the night. The pool on the roof is small but nice, there are flower pots and sunbeds all around and a tiny bar in which you can buy a beer or juices. The wiev from the roof is not that impressive, so don't get dissappointed. The hotel pub (in which they unsuccessfully had tried to create a british feel) was not too charming. Everyone smoked in there and you coul hardly breathe. The service there was not too impressive either, you had to wait for ages until you got your drink, and the drinks were kind of expensive. TV screens were every where in the pub, and the crowd was a mix of indian, english, arabs (drinking beer!) and other nationalities. Overall, we were very happy with the Excelsior Creek Hotel, and had a wonderful 5 night stay in Dubai. I would recommend this hotel to my best friend, which says a lot!

Reviews.Title: “WORTHY STAY”
Reviews.Author: gowd
Reviews.Content: DUBAI - EXCELSIOR CREEK HOTEL I and my wife stayed in creek hotel for about 4 days during Dubai shopping festival. the couteous staff gained first impression by procuring local sim for my wife who is eager to contact children back home at an odd hour. they collected our passports in a systematic way in a very short period to allocate rooms to my group. around 200 well furnished rooms cater all modern needs of traveller. what fasinated me more is nice wood work interiors in the rooms.As a man with a habit of bed coffee I found coffee maker in my room is not functioning. the hotel staff were again at service in the midnight to set it right by replacing the part. Nextly worthy to speak about the hotel is its morning break fast with beautiful natural ambience and rich spread of all types including dry fruits. The only disturbance during my stay is late night band or discothek which lasted till late night. Though expensive we done some shopping at sovenier shop. the hotel is 1/2 hour drive from airport and its located in old pakistan consulate area. Its proximity to metro and jumeran mall is a bonus for the traveller. It is also near to bank street,meena bazar for a shopoholic. I trust i will opt for the same in my next trip also. KIRAN GOWD B

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Central Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: rishigudka
Reviews.Content: Excelsior creek is an excellent well serviced hotel in a good locaton. We arrived at 10am to the hotel due to an early flight but were given the room straight away despite the check in time being at around 2pm. This was a very nice gesture of the hotel. We were given welcome drinks on arrival. We were given room on the top floor as requested which was well appointed. Service was generally good but rooms don't have much of a view. Roof top pool was small but adequate. Breakfast was very good with lots of variety. The hotel is located about a 5 min walk from metro and 5 min walk from Burjuman mall. Its only 15mins from airport by taxi and has a few restaurants including an indian restaurant, indian club, a cosy bar, Anwar, the buffet restaurant. As we had an early check-out on the last day the hotel kindly got us boxed breakfasts. All in all a good 4 star hotel in a very handy location. Walking distance to many shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel "IF" you get the right room...”
Reviews.Author: Amy-Chester-2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights either side of our cruise...the first 3 nights we were absolutely mortified...having read reviews about the noise from the hotels nightclub my partner emailed them many weeks in advance explaining this trip was for for a very special occasion & we would like a room with a nice view & away from the sound of the club, he received an email back saying this was fine. We checked in to a Deluxe room, 131 & we were VERY impressed with the size of the room & the plush furniture etc...more 5* than 4*. We had a large flat screen TV, huge bathroom with toiletries & 2 large double beds, perfect! Only downside was our non existent view on to an alley facing the neighbouring run down apartment block covered in bird dirt...room was also very dark. It was only that evening around 10pm that we started to hear the disco which was horrendous!!!!!! The bass vibrated through the room so badly that we could feel the vibrations in bed & the sound of the music was so loud it could be heard over the TV. This went on until 3am. Not ideal after a night flight from the UK when you've had no sleep!!! Next morning we asked reception if we could move rooms & expressed our upset at being placed on the first floor, seemingly directly above the club when we had emailed in advance & was assured we would be placed away from it! We received no real apology & was told the hotel was full. The noise & sleepless nights continued & our days were spoilt as we were SO tired! On the third night at 1.45am We were so cross we called reception & demanded to be moved as we wanted at least some sleep before joining our cruise the next day, the reception staff weren't too interested & told us they would ask the DJ to turn it down.at 2.20am the music was louder so we complained again & were finally moved rooms...same room but on 3rd floor where music could still be heard but not quite as loud. This just proves how loud the disco is when it keeps you awake on the top floor of the hotel!! It also amazes me how they managed to find a vacant room when apparently the hotel was fully booked!! The next morning at breakfast they tried to charge us as we had somehow been removed from the list & were mithered 2 or 3 times by different people for the room key back!! We called for the bell boy to help us with our cases down to reception but he never arrived..it was almost starting to seem personal! Upon check out we spoke to the duty manager who was extremely uninterested, made little eye contact, made no real apology & assured us that sound technicians would work on removing the speakers from the nightclub ceiling!!! Not much good to us when we hadn't slept for 3 days or to all the other guests who had been complaining for the past few months!why not remove the speakers then?? We asked for some form of compo as he clearly wasn't going to offer us any & he point blank refused, eventually he offered us a free transfer to the cruise terminal which is about 5 mile away (this didn't materialise as he was off duty come evening when we were due to leave & the other DM who was even ruder knew nothing about it). We did however get a complimentary lunch in the hotel restaurant which was worth about £10 each & we were assured that when we returned in 1 week we would have a quiet room (we were promised that before we arrived)! Checking in again on our second stay at the hotel after the cruise we were told the room wasn't ready (even though it was after the 2pm check in time) we waited in reception for about 1 hour & was given a free orange juice. The Duty Manager took us to room 263, we hadn't been upgraded but there were 2 bathrobes, a Rose & some bath bombs on the bed, lit candles around the bath which was filled with lovely Rose petals & shortly after a large basket of fruit was delivered to the room..we were very impressed!! We also had the view over the front of the hotel which we originally requested. Overall we were quite satisfied with the eventual outcome as the roses & candles were a nice touch to the room but it was a shame that it took an email, 3 sleepless nights & a lengthy discussion with the DM to get it! Overall it's a fabulous hotel & apart from the all night disco, I cannot really fault it..I can't even recommend emailing in advance to request a quiet room because we tried that! At check in just ask for a room that faces out to the front of the hotel as these are furthest away from the club..they just don't seem keen to rent these out?! Breakfast is ok, lots of choice but not really geared up for the Brittish & the pool area is nice, just hardly any loungers so get there early. Reception staff aren't overly helpful but will give you info if you need it. Taxis frequently stop outside the hotel & the metro is a 3 minute walk away & very cheap & efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay...but as the hotel is new many taxi drivers dont know about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sourabh1084
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 04 nights and had a pacakge inclusive of veg. buffet breakfast which was jus upto satisfactory. Talking about the location of this hotel, as it was inaugrated jus a year ago hence the taxi drivers don't know about this place. The location i.e Bank street, Bur Dubai is famous and hence we had to show the hotel map to each cabby to help him trace the hotel. And as the days passed we ourselves came to know about the surroundings which made it easy for us to locate the hotel later. The rules of the hotel are very very strict i.e firstly they had asked us a deposit of 400DHS as security deposit for each room which was not at all negotiable. Secondly we had requested for a late checkout for one of our 02 rooms booked but they did not agree and rather said that if you don't check out before 1300 hrs , then 50 % of the room rent will be charged. The staff was very polite and helpful, altogether it was a nice and comfortable stay at Hotel Excelsior Creek, Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excelsior!!!”
Reviews.Author: newblessing123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior Creek with my mother from 21st -31st January 2011. ARRIVAL Upon arrival we were greeted by very attentive staff who were assisting the taxi driver with the heavy suitcases before we had even got out the taxi. The front desk staff were all smiles and we were offered cool drinks whilst we were being checked in. Whilst sitting in the lobby area waiting the reception staff came to inform is that she was not able to give us the twin room we had requested as there was not one available but she would put an extra bed in a double room and would move us to the room we had requested as soon as possible. We had no problem with this. She was really apologetic. We were given a fruit basket for the room mix up but that was only after asking for something for the inconvenience. The staff helped us with our luggage and the room we were given was more than spacious the extra bed was already in there. Even with two beds there wad plenty of room. The furniture and amenities in the room were great. The room was spotless and clean. Nice flat screen TV with plenty of channels to choose from , plenty were in English. Some channels showed a 2 movies a night 9pm and 11pm this was standard TV no extra charge. Bathroom was a good size in excellent condition and immaculate. A previous review said the water was not very hot and we had the same problem but we called reception and they sent someone immediately to rectify the problem and it was just that we had not pulled the tap on the shower/bath far enough to the left. They have 3 phones in the room. One in the bathroom and two in the main bedroom. FOOD We had paid for bed and breakfast. The breakfast was great, full of variety and plenty of it you can go up as many times as you want. They had fresh fruit, cereal, omelettes and fried eggs cooked to order. Beef Bacon was great. They had traditional food as well as regular toast, crossings and jam. We ate at the hotel most evenings. Again the food was great they have the anwar restaurant which serves a buffet meal for 69 dhs per person which is about 16 gbp per head. It included salad, soup, chicken, fish, rice, vegetables again so much choice and really nice. There was desert too and still water was also included. You could make as much trips to food counter as you wanted although one was enough for me!! They have a roof top swimming pool and bar at night they do a bbq which is 99 dhs/ approx 20 gbp per person. Food is cooked to order. Lamb and chicken kebab skewers using good quality meat they have seafood skewers too. This all came with homous, corn on the cob, pitta bread. Again still water was included. It often was not busy up on the roof. I think they served till 11 pm. THE POOL The pool area was really clean and well kept it was a little cold but with the heat of the UAE sun that was soon forgotten. They have a sort of tent area that is great for when the heat gets too much or when you want to read a book.or watch tv. They have good wicker furniture in there too. The staff will get you dries which you can have by the pool and charge to your room. They play music by the pool which is also nice. SPA FACILITIES They have a sauna and a steam room which we used. They have separate times for men and women so if you thinking if enjoying the sauna and steam with your partner forget it , but it is to be expected in a Muslim country and it is to be respected. Personal I took no issue with this. Both sauna and steam were very clean although seats in the sauna are a little rickety and could do with a visit from a hammer and nails! We had a few massages also which were cheaper than it would be in the UK but if you book a few you may get a deal but beware the manager likes to suggest all sorts of other treatments and before you know it your paying to have your hair done when you only came up for a massage. BUSINESS CENTRE The business centre is small but is fit for the purpose, in our case to check-in online prior to going home, again reasonable prices. LOCATION Great location. Literally across the road from a convince store called Orange supermarket, its a 5 min walk. It sells snacks, drinks even fresh fruit and beg. Prices reasonable. The hotel is located 5-10 min walk from Burjaman shopping centre with all the shopping you could want. There are also many currency exchange places, a pharmacy and local resturants. They have the fast food chains such as McDonald's, KFC (they deliver), Nando's and Pizza Hut if you like that sort of thing. The Creek is 5 mins away in a taxi and you can shop till you drop and get great bargains. The metro is a 5 min walk away from the hotel. TIPS This was not my first trip to Dubai so these are things I have picked up on this trip and previously. The hotel has a tourist desk that sells excursions DO haggle the price the give you on some trips ie the safari is not fixed but they don't tell you that. Various companies do the same excursion and take you to a central point but they charge different prices. DON'T change your currency at the hotel you will get a better rate if your prepared to walk 5 mins down the road. Taxi's are really cheap but you will find that traveling from the airport to the hotel in a taxi will cost you more than your return journey as the airport taxi's work on a higher rate. We had no problem with the taxi's finding the hotel but if in doubt tell them to head for the Burjaman shopping mall and its literally across the busy road from the Orange supermarket (open 24 hrs). Dubai has a funny system when it comes to making phone calls. If you call someone and they don't answer after a few seconds the phone company begin to charge you just because it ringing. This is nor the fault of the hotel just the telecommunication company. OVERALL Great holiday, great hotel it's s real gem. I could not fault the service, food or accommodation. Great staff nothing was too much. Great value for money. Did not want to leave would stay there in a heartbeat again. In fact we are going back in April.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel in a poor area”
Reviews.Author: paulawales_11
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms are dark and dingy, we had to move rooms because of the noise coming from the 2 clubs that are in the hotel, it reverbarated throughout the hotel. A taxi trip is needed as you would not want to walk from this hotel, and taxi drivers do not know its location. The 2 nights we stayed were "hell" and we would not want others to suffer what we did. I have stayed in Dubai on more than 4 occasions, and this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excelsior !!!”
Reviews.Author: mumsi53
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at the Excelsior Creek and had a lovely time. The service was very good and the staff smiley and helpful. The hotel is central with the Creek and Metro close by and a good choice for tourists wanting to visit the sights. The free daily shuttle buses to the shopping mall and beach are a bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: avranga
Reviews.Content: Good decent hotel with all amenities. Staff polite and helpful. Has 2 decent nightclubs and a "English" pub to while away your nights. Rooms well appointed and the food is great. Well located, walking distance from the Metro. Burjuman mall is very close. Only complaint is the electronic keys which were very fussy refusing to work most of the times!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bondhublr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was on a business trip. I finished my meetings but had to stay longer in Dubai so checked in to this hotel with my father. I was really surprised when I arrived at this hotel. For the price I paid this hotel was just superb. The rooms were very neat, the bathroom was excellent with great amenities. The location is just superb with a metro station 3 min walk away. A big prominent mall 5 min away. Indian food 5 min away. The dubai creek, gold souk, Dubai museum all pretty near by (10 dhs by taxi). The front office was very efficient. One draw back was that the room's electronic keys are of pretty inferior quality. I had to swipe more than 10 times to get access! All in all a very very good place to stay for about 300 dhs with Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Motel on top of a nightclub”
Reviews.Author: andyanthill
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. First room had a view of a derelict building and sounded like it was on top of a nightclub. After we changed rooms it was better but could still hear the pumping music. The waiter took our payment for our bar bill and took it as a tip and when we checked out we were presented with the bill that we had already paid. Overall it was clean and would rate it a 2.5 star and not stay again

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Britishgoabroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, we got a welcome drink and cold towel in the reception on arrival. the rooms were very spacious and of good quality. The air conditioning was good and easy to adjust. There is a good sized swimming pool on the roof which was a nice treat. Breakfast was included in our rate and was very good, there was a big selection of hot and cold. Including waffles, pancakes and omelets cooked to order. There were lots of staff around who were always very polite. The location is excellent we took the metro from the airport and this was very easy and cheap. You can easily walk to the creek and the metro is very close.

Reviews.Title: “Little sleep plus bad service”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Jayne82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of different hotels and I have to say, I was very disappointed with Excelsior Creek Hotel. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful but the room I stayed in was just ok - the furniture and furnishings didn't feel 4 star quality in my opinion. It was clean though and the bed was comfortable. I wanted room service but when I looked at the limited 'hotel directory' provided in the room, the menu wasn't in there. I had to request someone to bring up the room service menu, which is odd in itself. Then I called room service to get an explanation of the different dishes as I wanted an Indian dish & the menu didn't explain what the dish was, only the Indian name. The man on the other end of the phone was disinterested and didn't really explain anything to me - he made me feel like I was wasting his time. Later when I wanted something from the mini bar, I opened the fridge and it was empty - I would have had to request for someone to bring to my room anything I would want from the mini bar. Again, strange and rather inconvenient. I brought my own laptop and used the internet provided by the hotel via cable (not wireless) - I selected 30 minutes of internet. Out of all this time I probably got about 5 minutes worth of usage as the internet went from either not working at all to being excruciatingly slow. I called for an engineer twice but no one came, they did call me but only to tell me that the cause of my problem was because the time I had paid for had come to an end. They didn't have an answer as to why I had problems from the second I logged in and by the time they offered to come up, I was already fed up with it all and had given up. I complained about this when I checked out but I still had to pay for the 30 minutes. Lastly but by no means least - I didn't get to sleep until about 4am on Friday morning. The music from the bar at the hotel literally made my room vibrate with the bass. It was very loud & I couldn't sleep until it stopped. I didn't bother to complain at the time as I was checking out later that day & didn't fancy moving rooms at 1am. When I was checking out they asked me 'so the music wasn't too loud for you?’ They obviously knew when I checked in that the room they gave me would be subject to loud noise from the bar... Nice. Another annoying thing, admittedly not the hotels fault, is that of all the taxi's I took no one knew where the hotel was. I will definitely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, 5mins to metro”
Reviews.Author: ataz_backpacker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty new, some taxi drivers may not know where is it, just tell them near burjuman mall. It is 5min walk to the khalid bin al waleed metro station, quite convenience. We booked directly at AED300 per night, inclusive of breakfast. Drawback is their housekeeping which they did not replace the used towel and used body lotion. And do the bill when you checkout as they charged us wrongly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Hazines_World
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our 4 night stay at Excelsior Creek, which opened last year. For the mid budget price, the hotel exceeded our expectations. We booked online through their website, and we check in without any hitches or glitches. We found the rooms to be spotlessly clean, well furnished, quiet, and spacious. The beds were very comfortable, with soft duvets, and we appreciated the touch of plush robes and slippers hanging in the closet. The view wasn't outstanding, but perfectly fine, and the nice big windows let in lots of natural light. The bathroom was also sleek, spacious, and spotlessly clean. A nice touch was the scale in the bathroom, though after 4 days of eating out, I wasn't too happy with the readings :) The service was excellent. Everyone we interacted with was polite, friendly, and professional. They really made the extra effort to make sure our stay was enjoyable and responded graciously to all our requests. We only used the restaurant in the lovely atrium one time, for breakfast. The continental fare was fine, complete with an omelet station. It was a bit pricey and I would have enjoyed some more selections from the region itself, though I did enjoy the olives, hummus, and soft tangy feta cheese. There is also an English Pub but we never went there. We did order room service once or twice as well, which we enjoyed. My only complaint was that the water wasn't hot enough. We called to have it fixed and someone came immediately, but it didn't seem to make much difference, it only went from lukewarm to warm. If they are able to give an option for hot water they will keep their western patrons happier. Another strength for the hotel is the location. It is a very short walk to Bur Juman shopping center and the new metro (Khalid bin al Waleed station). It is also near the Bastakia Quarter, Dubai Museum, the Creek, and other attractions. We never had a problem catching a cab near the hotel either. We would definitely return to the Excelsior Creek for future stays in Dubai and highly recommend it, based on our experience.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Bur Dubai - Embassy District
HotelInfo.Address: Al Hamriya Khaleed Bin Waleed, 20th Street, Dubai 111454, United Arab Emirates
